intro: Gomphrena portulacoides, commonly known as the trailing gomphrena, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its compact, trailing growth habit. The plant produces small, showy flowers in shades of pink, red, and purple, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to thrive in arid conditions. Gomphrena portulacoides is often cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and landscapes due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
